data.title: Paediatricians call for fund to help poorer families get to hospital appointments
data.meta_description:
Paediatricians have called for the rest of the UK to follow Scotland in introducing a fund to help families with low incomes get to hospital appointments.

This is one of the recommendations in an updated position statement by the Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health (RCPCH), which highlights that 30% of children are now living in poverty and are more likely to have poorer health outcomes.1

The Young Patients Family Fund was set up in Scotland in March 20232 to remove some of the financial barriers facing families when visiting a baby, child, or young person in hospital. It allows parents, carers, and siblings aged under 18 to claim some of the costs associated with visiting a young patient in hospital.

The RCPCH recommends that the Scottish government should expand this fund to include inpatients and outpatients …
